title: Woman faces charge after 5-year-old shoots self
content:
A 32-year-old woman faces a second-degree misdemeanor charge for failure to secure a dangerous ordnance after her 5-year-old stepson accidentally shot himself inside her home at 4042 Mayview Drive.
“She’ll be receiving a summons to appear in court on the charges,” said Trotwood Police Capt,. John Porter.
No adults were home at the time of the shooting, which was reported to Trotwood police around 2 p.m. on Sunday.
The 5-year-old, who was not severely injured, was in the house with his two brothers, ages 15 and 11, at the time of the shooting.
“They were kind of overseeing him, but he wandered,” Porter said.
Police believe the 5-year-old found a Taurus semi-automatic pistol in a drawer in a bedroom and began playing with it when it went off.
“We believe that he was either placing it into his pocket or trying to put it into his pocket, similar to a holster … like a cowboy. When he did, the weapon discharged, grazing the front of his leg,” Porter said.
The 5-year-old was taken to Dayton Children’s to be treated for non-life-threatening injuries.
A woman who answered the door at the Mayview Drive address on Tuesday declined to comment on the incident when approached by a newspaper reporter.
Montgomery County Children Services was also notified about the incident.
The woman faces the second-degree misdemeanor charge because she owns the firearm.
Porter said this incident was preventable.
“Parents should always ensure that the firearms are secured safely and that the children are aware of the rules and regulations,” Porter said. “Gunlocks are appropriate and should be used, especially when the parents are not at home.”
